body.description: Supports 3rd Gen AMD Ryzen Processors Dual Channel ECC/ Non-ECC Unbuffered DDR4, 4 DIMMs 12plus2 Phases Digital Twin Power Design with 50A DrMOS Advanced Thermal Design with Enlarged Surface Heatsinks Ultra Durable PCIe 4.0 x16 Slot Dual Ultra-Fast NVMe PCIe 4.0/3.0 x4 M.2 with Dual Thermal Guards Onboard Intel WiFi 6 802.11ax 2T2R & BT5 with AORUS Antenna AMP-UP Audio with ALC1200 and WIMA Capacitors Blazing Fast 2.5GbE LAN with Bandwidth Management Front USB 3.2 Gen1 Type-C and DisplayPort & HDMI for Multiple Display RGB FUSION 2.0 Supports Addressable LED & RGB LED Strips Smart Fan 5 Features Multiple Temperature Sensors, Hybrid Fan Headers with FAN STOP Q-Flash Plus Update BIOS without Installing the CPU, Memory and Graphics Card Pre-installed IO Shield for Easy and Quick Installation.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Motherboard BIOS update for AMD Ryzen 5000 series processors Motherboard BIOS update for AMD Ryzen 5000 series processors From GIGABYTE’s website, download the latest compressed BIOS update file that matches your motherboard model from its product page.Uncompress the downloaded BIOS file, save it to your USB flash drive, and rename it to GIGABYTE.bin. Note: The USB flash drive must use the FAT32/16 file system.Insert the USB flash drive into the white USB port or BIOS Q Flash port on the back panel of your motherboard (USB port may not be labelled on all models, checking the user manual is recommended)Connect the power cables to the CPU 8 Pin power connector (connect either one if there are two) and mainboard 24 Pin power connector.Press the Q-Flash Plus button (location may vary by model) and the system will automatically search and match the BIOS file in the USB flash drive on the white USB port. The QFLED and the Q-Flash Plus button on the rear panel will flash during the BIOS matching and flashing process. Wait for 2-3 minutes and the QFLED will stop flashing when the BIOS flashing is complete.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best MOBO for AM4 for a Midrange build
reviews.reviewText: this MOBO is excellent and it has a lot of future for the price, like USB C, AMP Audio chip, Digital VRM, PCIe4.0, USB3.2, Realtek ALC1200, Intel WiFi 6, 2xM.2 Thermal Guard and Bluetooth all you need for a good gaming machine is in this MOBO, I recommend it, BIOS is easy to upgrade but some of these MOBOs are all ready RYZEN 5000 ready out of the box just need to verify on the box before buy if doesn't say it you can update the bios without a CPU using the USB flash input on the back.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great PCIe 4.0 Board For AM4
reviews.reviewText: I wanted to upgrade my Aorus B450 Elite so I could switch to a 40-series GPU and this was the most sensible choice since I didn't need to install any new software from a different manufacturer. The USB speeds and compatibility are definitely improved from the B450 model.Worth noting, the headers for CPU and case fans were swapped on this board from what I had in the past but that was easily redone when wiring the new board.Performance is great and everything runs smooth. For reference my build is a Ryzen 9 5900X and an RTX 4070ti Super (Gigabyte Gaming OC)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy build and set up
reviews.reviewText: Great value. easy build and set up with Ryzen 7. Bios is easy to navigate

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great board - Bluetooth needs work
reviews.reviewText: The good: This mobo looks great and installs easily. The dual m.2 slots and the heat syncs that cover them are nice and everything is pretty easy to access. Also comes with an adapter to simplify connection of the tiny power switch/LED and reset connectors.The bad: BIOS update required out of the box. This is simple and the BIOS interface makes it super easy. Just kind of crummy the board doesn’t ship with latest already installed.Bluetooth keeps dropping. Research indicates that this may be due to the hardware having issues waking from hibernation, but Gigabyte support appears to be ignoring the issue at this point. The only workaround people have found is to flush your capacitors (power off, unplug, wait, then reverse). If you’re gaming and use a BT controller, you may want to find alternatives to this board or wait until this issue is cleared. The way their support is responding to the issue (or not, really) could mean a long wait on that one...Still, overall, I do like this mobo a lot. So if native Bluetooth support isn’t high on your list of wants, I would recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A really great motherboard
reviews.reviewText: I was upgrading my mobo from the Gigabyte B550ｍ because I was in need of a wifi. This mobo has a ton of great features and the wifi is incredibly fast. I like all of the USB A plugs it offers as well as the USB C support. The mobo lights can be programmed with RGB fusion, and I haven't really had a problem with it so far.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice board with a good BIOS interface, and decent software
reviews.reviewText: This board is definitely better than my ASRock B550M Steel Legend. The BIOS is easier for tuning, and being a larger board has more M2 slots. The built-in WiFi/Bluetooth is also really nice. Doesn't have as nice of a RGB layout on the board itself if that's what you're into, but that wasn't a deal breaker for me. I've also experienced an MSI motherboard recently that a friend had for a Ryzen 7800X3D... gotta say I wasn't a huge fan of that BIOS interface either. The Gigabyte is by far the superior of the three, though I don't have recent experience to compare it with an Asus board. I'm very happy with this board and would choose it again in a heartbeat, unless I have some experience with Asus and am blown away by it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars rog strix is better
reviews.reviewText: previously i had a rog strix b350-f motherboard on my system and thought it was time for a upgrade since i have upgraded my CPU in the 7 years of its life from a ryzen 5 to a ryzen 7. there was no issues and its been perfect for a year. i get the b550 ax v2 and instantly its better than my old motherboard where download speeds were awful, not surpassing 20 mbps on internet when i have 1G. the b550 was able to download 60+ mbps on epic and 500+ mbps on steam (internet), everything was smooth for a month until suddenly my screen goes blank and my fans kick to high speeds. i take a week trying to tweak the motherboard with gigabyte having 6 different versions of this exact motherboard adn 2 different websites to access them, finding the bios software was impossible to find. once the new bios was installed CORRECTLY the problem occurred even faster not even letting me get 10 min of productivity (Fortnite) in. i decided to switch back the the rog b350 and well enough it works perfectly i'm able to multitask and the download speeds have improved oddly enough.also Bluetooth doesn't work even with upgraded drivers.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Easy to install, came with included bluetooth and wifi antenna, only gripe with the product is that the m.2 heatsinks could have better screws as in they are very loose even when fully tightened. replaced a B450m ds3h with this and my idle power draw dropped by a whopping 20 watts

Me parecieron muy buenas que un amigo y yo compramos dos placas, cheque y compare características con otras placas y marcas, y esta esta muy completa por le precio la vale, ya que mas caro ya seria para nuevas generaciones de procesadores y esta ya venia lista para la seria 5000 y el rendimiento me sorprendió demasiado, sin duda la recomiendo.

Exactly what you would expect, with a 12+2 power phase set up, chances of overheat or damage on the rail are very low and decent for OC. RGB is a little lackluster but for the price point, it's fine. Really good software that includes fan curves for case/CPU/pump. As well as a program that simplifies the bios update process, although the board came with updated Bios anyway.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good value for the feature set, one minor issue.
reviews.reviewText: One of the cheaper b550 board w/ wifi you can find on the market. Due to personal reason have to use WLAN, was choosing between asus tuf plus and this one.Pros: Full feature set you can expect from b550, good VRM thermal, no heat problem for multi-core OC (I don't have a 5900x so idk about that one, but if you use R9 might as well go for x570). Have more than enough io for most pc users; the free antenna works perfectly, great signal strength. The bios update and tweaking was smooth without any issue. Overall experience was good, definitely recommend.Cons: B550 AORUS Mobo family has this common issue of failing to detect bluetooth adaptor, so you will see bluetooth missing in the system(even after you show hidden item in device manager). This can be solved by cold booting the system (i.e. cut off the power from outlet or off the PSU before next bootup). I guess this is a BIOS problem as something in the HW power up sequence was not properly reset, detected or timed. Anyway, at the time of this review, latest BIOS haven't solve the problem.P.S. If your pc case doesn't have any front usb-c port, go for V1.

The media could not be loaded. No necesite actualizar la BIOS para que funcionará con Ryzen 5800x, está lista para montar y encender sin actualizar la BIOS, llevo utilizandola por casi 3 años y no tendrás problemas de sobrecalentamiento ni fallos alguno, el puerto m.2 funciona perfectamente, muy recomendable motherboard, te durará bastantes años, la mejor calidad precio. El software RGB Fusion para manejar los Leds, es muy malo, muy básico, pero eso es algo que Gigabyte siempre a tenido, en cambio utilizo Signal RGB para una mejor sincronización de todos los componentes LED dentro del pc.
